With Generous Donations, SCOE Launches Technology Support Fund

Thanks to a generous donation from Bank of Marin, the Sonoma County Office of Education (SCOE) is launching a Technology Support Fund intended to help school districts and families purchase the mobile hotspots, prepaid data plans, computers, and subscriptions to online learning plans needed to access and deliver distance learning this year.

The Technology Support Fund is seeded through a $50,000 donation from Bank of Marin and received an additional $11,400 donation from the Santa Rosa Express Youth Running Club. The hope is that other individuals, businesses, and community organizations will also be inspired to donate to this fund so that more students can be served by it.

Read more here: https://bit.ly/3jNF5Ob

Heat related illness can happen to anyone which is why it is important to learn the signs and symptoms and utilize prevention as a defense.

There are three variations of heat stress: heat cramps, heat exhaustion (also called heat prostration or collapse,) and the real killer, heatstroke. Collectively, these conditions are known as heat stress.

Tips for Preventing Heat-Related Stress:

*Pre-hydrate and continue to drink plenty of fluids ‚Äì do not wait until you are thirsty to drink

*Stay cool ‚Äì wear appropriate clothing. Lightweight, light-colored, loose-fitting

*Limit outdoor activities or plan to be outside when it is coolest such as morning and evening hours

*Cut down on exercise during the heat

*Wear sunscreen

*Avoid hot and heavy meals

*Limit caffeine intake ‚Äì caffeine has a diuretic effect which can lead to dehydration

*Take adequate meal and rest breaks

*Never leave animals or children in parked cars even if the windows are cracked open

Interested persons, who live within the boundaries of the Roseland School District, are U.S. Citizens and registered voters, are welcome to apply for the existing vacancy.

Completed applications for Board consideration must be received by the Roseland School District no later than 4:00 p.m. on May 29, 2020. Applications can be found here: https://bit.ly/2xVkswE. Interested candidates can email their completed application to Kristin Enbysk at kenbysk@roselandsd.org.

Qualifying candidates will be interviewed by the Roseland School District Board of Trustees at a board meeting in June. The successful candidate will be appointed to hold office until the November 2022 election. Board meetings are held on the third Wednesday of each month at 5:30 pm, with the exception of the month of July.

Please call the Roseland School District Office at (707) 545-0102, if you have any questions or need more information.
